greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Product_{k>0} (1 - 1/8^k).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1200
formula: Equals Exp(-Sum_{n>0} sigma_1(n)/n*(1/8)^n) where sigma_1() is A000203().
Equals (1/8; 1/8)_{infinity}, where (a;q)_{infinity} is the q-Pochhammer symbol. - _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 26 2015
mathematica: digits = 103; NProduct[1-1/8^k, {k, 1, Infinity}, NProductFactors -> 100, WorkingPrecision -> digits+3] // N[#, digits+3]& // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 18 2014 *)
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 14 2007
